question: Which of the following statements about hard and soft iron in relation to magnetism is correct ?
answer: Hard iron magnetism is of a permanent nature and soft iron is a non-permanent nature.
choiceone: Both hard and soft iron are of a non-permanent nature.
choicetwo: Hard iron magnetism is of a non-permanent nature and soft iron is a permanent nature.

question:
Which of the following statements concerning the aircraft positions indicated on a triple fit Inertial Navigation System
( INS ) / Inertial Reference System ( IRS ) on the CDU is correct ?
answer: The positions are likely to differ because they are calculated from different sources.
choiceone:
The positions will only differ if an error has been made when inputting the present position at the departure
 airport.
choicetwo: The positions will be the same because they are an average of three different positions.
choicethree: The positions will only differ if one of the systems has been decoupled because of a detected malfunction.

question:
Which of the following statements concerning the alignment procedure for Inertial Navigation Systems ( INS ) / Inertial
Reference Systems ( IRS ) at mid-latitudes is correct ?
answer: INS/IRS can be aligned in either the ALIGN or NAV mode.
choiceone: INS/IRS can only be aligned in NAV mode.
choicetwo: INS/IRS can be aligned in either the ALIGN or ATT mode.
choicethree: INS/IRS can only be aligned in the ALIGN mode.

question:
Which of the following statements concerning the loss of alignment by an Inertial Reference System ( IRS ) in flight is
correct ?
answer:
The navigation mode , including present position and ground speed outputs , is inoperative for the remainder
 of the flight.
choiceone: It is not usable in any mode and must be shut down for the rest of the flight.
choicetwo: The IRS has to be coupled to the remaining serviceable system and a realignment carried out in flight.
choicethree:
The mode selector has to be rotated to ATT then back through ALIGN to NAV in order to obtain an in-flight
 realignment.

question:
Which of the following statements concerning the operation of an Inertial Navigation System ( INS ) / Inertial Reference

choiceone: NAV mode must be selected on the runway just prior to take-off.
choicetwo: NAV mode must be selected prior to the loading of passengers and/or freight.
choicethree: NAV mode must be selected when the alignment procedure is commenced.

choicethree: It is constantly updated from information obtained by the FMC.

Gyro-compassing of an INS is possible in flight because it can differentiate between movement induced and
 misalignment induced accelerations.
choicetwo:
Gyro-compassing of an INS is possible in flight because it cannot differentiate between movement induced
 and misalignment induced accelerations.
choicethree:
Gyro-compassing of an INS is not possible in flight because it can differentiate between movement induced
 and misalignment induced accelerations.

question: Which of the following statements is correct concerning the effect of turning errors on a direct reading compass ?
answer: Turning errors are greatest on north/south headings , and are greatest at high latitudes.
choiceone: Turning errors are greatest on east/west headings , and are greatest at high latitudes.
choicetwo: Turning errors are greatest on north/south headings , and are least at high latitudes.
choicethree: Turning errors are greatest on east/west headings , and are least at high latitudes.

choiceone: They are all curves concave to the equator.

question: Which statement about meridians is correct ?
answer: A meridian and its anti-meridian form a complete great circle.
choiceone: All meridians are parallel to the Meridian of Greenwhich.
choicetwo: The plane of a meridian is parallel to the equator.
choicethree: A meridian is a complete great circle of 360º.

question: Which statement about ST is true ?
answer:
Standard time is determined by the goverment of the appropriate state and does not necessarily follow the
 borders of 15º wide longitude zones.
choiceone: The standard time at 125ºW is UTC 8 h 20 m.
choicetwo:
Standard time is the time that is determinedby division of the longitude by 15 and rounding off the answer to
 the nearest integer.
choicethree: In all cases the standard times at Western longitudes are slow on and at Eastern longitudes fast on UTC.

question: Which statement about the duration of daylight is true ?
answer: Close to the equinoxes the influence of latitude on the duration of daylight is at its smallest.
choiceone:
On September 10th the duration of daylight is longer on the Southern Hemisphere than on the Northern
 Hemisphere.
choicetwo: In summer the length of the period of daylight decreases with increasing latitude.
choicethree: Close to the solstices the influence of latitude on the duration of daylight is at its smallest.

question: Which statement about the orbit of the earth is correct ?
answer: The orbit of the earth around the sun is an ellipse with the sun at one of the foci.
choiceone: The orbit of the earth around the sun is an ellipse with the sun at a point halfway between the two foci.
choicetwo: The orbit of the earth is a circle with the sun at a point next to its centre.
choicethree: The orbit of the earth around the sun is a circle with the sun at its centre.

question: Which statement is correct ?
answer: The earth is one of the planets which are all moving in elliptical orbit around the sun.
choiceone: The Solar System consists of the sun , planets and stars.
choicetwo: The sun moves in an elliptical orbit around the Earth.
choicethree: The planets move around the sun like all stars of the Solar System.

question: Which statement is correct about the apparent solar day ?
answer:
The apparent solar day is the period between two successive transits of the true sun through the same
 meridian.
choiceone:
The duration of the apparent solar day is constant throughout a year due to the constant velocity of the earth
 in its orbit around the sun.
choicetwo:
The duration of the apparent solar day is constant throughout a year due to the constant rotational speed of
 the earth around its axis.
choicethree:
The apparent solar day is the period between two successive transits of the mean sun through the same
 meridian.

question: Which statement is correct about the scale of a Lambert projection ?
answer: The scale reaches its minimum value at the parallel of origin.
choiceone: The scale reaches its minimum value at the standard parallels.
choicetwo: The scale reaches its maximum value at the parallel of origin.
choicethree: The scale reaches its maximum value at the standard parallels.

question: Which statement is correct about the scale of a Polar Stereographic projection of the Northern polar area ?
answer: The scale reaches its minimum value at the North pole.
choiceone: The scale reaches its maximum value at the 45ºN.
choicetwo: The scale reaches its minimum value at the equator.
choicethree: The scale reaches its maximum value at the North pole.

question: Which statement is true ?
answer: The declination of the sun and the latitude of the observer will affect the duration of civil twilight.
choiceone:
Civil twilight at the equator lasts longer than at 60ºN or 60ºS because the radius of the equator is larger than
 the radius of the 60º parallel.
choicetwo: Only the declination of the sun will affect the duration of civil twilight.
choicethree:
The duration of the civil twilight on 21st of March and on 23rd of September is equal at all places on Earth
 independent of latitude.

question: Which statement is true about the parallel of origin of a conformal chart ?
answer: The parallel of origin is the parallel at which the scale reaches its minimum value.
choiceone:
The parallel of origin together with the standard parallel(s) , are the only parallels at which the chart is
 conformal.
choicetwo: The parallel of origin is the only parallel at which the chart is conformal.
choicethree: The parallel of origin is the parallel at which the scale reaches its maximum value.

question: Which statement regarding the apparent sun and the mean sun is correct ?
answer: The apparent sun is the visible sun , the mean sun is a fictitious sun.
choiceone: The apparent sun is a fictitious sun coupled to UTC , the mean sun is related to the local mean time.
choicetwo: The mean sun moves along the ecliptic , the apparent sun along the celestial equator.
choicethree: The apparent sun is not important for naviation as difference in time with the mean sun is maximal 4 seconds.
